alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:35PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rio Blanco and east central Uintah Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 434 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Dinosaur, or 29 miles southeast of Vernal, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dinosaur. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 5 and 11. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
